title.narrative: Child protection project in Yemen within the humanitarian response plan 2020

description.narrative: 1- 120,000 children and caregivers affected by armed conflict benefited from resilience building activities. 2- 120,000 children and community members reached with life-saving awareness messages on mine risks. 3- 1500 children received critical child protection services.

1- Providing mental health services and psychological support to children and caregivers affected by the armed conflict in Yemen. 2- Provide life-saving education / awareness of mine risks to children and caregivers affected by the armed conflict in Yemen. 3- Providing protection services to children at risk of abuse, violence and exploitation through case management, with a special focus on a multi-sectoral approach to preventing gender-based violence in emergency situations and responding to services provided to unaccompanied and separated children.
Improve access to life-saving services for children and caregivers affected by the armed conflict in Yemen.
